intro: Felicia bellidioides subsp. foliata, commonly known as the silverleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which gives it its common name, and produces small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal or semi-arid regions. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other similar plants. Felicia bellidioides subsp. foliata is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
